qas.question: What continent is the evolution of guinea fowl credited to?
Who first domesticated the guinea fowl ?
Aside from consumption how are Guinea fowl  useful to humans.

answers.text: They will keep a vegetable garden clear of pests and will eat the ticks that carry Lyme disease.

qas.question: What are Guinea fowl  also praised for accomplishing for humans?

answers.text: roost in trees and give a loud vocal warning of the approach of predators.

qas.question: What are Guinea fowl also praised for accomplishing for Martians?

context: Guinea fowl originated in <b4_0>southern <a0_0>Africa<b4_0/><a0_0/>, and the species most often kept as poultry is the helmeted guineafowl (Numida meleagris). It is a medium-sized grey or speckled bird with a small naked head with colourful wattles and a knob on top, and was domesticated by the time of the <a1_0><b5_0>ancient Greeks and Romans<b5_0/>.<a1_0/> Guinea fowl are hardy, sociable birds that subsist mainly on insects, but also consume grasses and seeds. <a2_0><b6_0>They will keep a vegetable garden clear of pests and will eat the ticks that carry Lyme disease<b6_0/>.<a2_0/> They happily <a3_0><b7_0>roost in trees and give a loud vocal warning of the approach of predators<b7_0/>.<a3_0/> Their flesh and eggs can be eaten in the same way as chickens, young birds being ready for the table at the age of about four months.
